channel.title: DevHawk tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from DevHawk.

item.description: I resolved my winget / PC Health Check upgrade issue by uninstalling PC Health Check via uninstall UI in settings app. For some reason, there were TWO copies of PC Health Check installed, which apparently confused winget to the point of being unable to update or uninstall either
winget: still not quite ready for prime time

ICYMI, winget still ... not great. Now I'm having issues with the Windows PC Health Check app.
According to winget, I have v3.2.2110.14001 installed and v3.3.2110.22002 is available. upgrade --all downloads and runs an msi, but winget still reports upgrade available.
PC Health Check about box shows it's been updated to 3.3.2110.22002 already, even if winget seems to think it's not. [link]

Plus PowerToys popped up a dialog saying v0.55.2 update was available...right after winget installed (checks notes) v0.55.1.
So winget mistakenly thinks PC Health Check has not been updated when it has AND it also mistakenly thinks PowerToys is up to date when it is not.
@tillig I've been meaning to experiment with Plex. Thanks for the suggestion
This is why Windows Runtime exists. [link]

I was the original dev for App Execution Aliases. So I was able to point @jandedobbeleer in the right direction to make #ohmyposh work with the Windows Store version of Python. No biggie, just helping out the @golang community without actually being a @golang dev ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ [link]
@davemangot @TIDAL Doesn't @tidal already have a playlist import feature?
@patrickallmond You know, I'm not allergic to hearing the word "Apple" . I got Jules an iPhone last fall and I've have a Mac mini on my desk at work for years (tho I rarely use it).

@somniumwave @schlummer2k @TIDAL Well, we can. I mean there had to be a local music player app on modern mobile platforms right?
But having access to most music without having to rip CDs is just way too convenient to give up. It's been forever since I bought physical media and I don't want to go back now
@schlummer2k @somniumwave @TIDAL @HumswapNeo I don't think that let's me upload my own music (though playlist import is a nice feature to have)

@somniumwave Cc @schlummer2k what about custom tracks on @TIDAL? I have some music from old friends bands that isn't available on any streaming service. I used to use Groove Music from MSFT ('natch) and I loved the OneDrive integration. Spotify has limited support for this, but it's a PITA

I'm looking for music service other than fucking Spotify? Suggestions?
Preferably something with a family plan, the ability to host custom tracks and doesn't fund a misogynistic racist asshole to the tune of $100 million.

@jezell Disagree. I liked the story BoBF was telling. Plenty of interesting stuff going on (that train heist!) plus lots of nostalgia hits (Hutts! a Rancor!). But then they pause to show Mando restore a spaceship and Luke train Baby Yoda? Save that for Mandolorian S3
There sure hasn't been much Boba Fett on the last couple episodes of <checks notes> the Book of Boba Fett TV show. [link]
